titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Morris Rosenzweig Papers WAG.273
titlestmt.author: Tamiment Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-11-22 16:20:00 -0500.

change.item: Record updated by Rachel Searcy to reflect 2020 accretion
Record updated by Rachel Searcy to reflect 2021 accretion

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

physdesc.extent: in 2 manuscript boxes and one oversized box

did.abstract: Morris Rosenzweig was the comptroller of District 65/United Automobile Workers. This collection contains clippings, booklets, buttons, photographs, artifacts, ephemera and a typescript on the history of District 65 written by Morris Rosenzweig.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist, materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Morris Rosenzweig Papers; WAG 273; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Sheldon Rosenzweig, Morris Rosenzweig's son, in 2008, 2015, 2020, and 2021. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 2008.004, 2015.013, and 2021.023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains clippings, booklets, buttons, photographs, newspapers, artifacts (jacket, caps, luggage tag, leather case), ephemera and a typescript on the history of District 65 written by Morris Rosenzweig.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Morris Rosenzweig was the comptroller of District 65/United Automobile Workers.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Duplicate photographs and typescripts, as well as membership booklets with personally identifiable information, were returned to the donor.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2021 are unknown. In 2021 an accretion of photographs and a leather UAW case with buttons were rehoused in archival folders and incorporated into the collection in Box 1. A further accretion later in 2021 of documents was added to the collection as Box 3.

controlaccess.corpname: International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace, and Agricultural Implement Workers of America. District 65
Distributive, Processing, and Office Workers of America. District 65
United Automobile, Aircraft, and Vehicle Workers of America. District 65

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accretion to the Morris Rosenzweig Papers consists of documentation related to Morris Rosenzweig's work in UAW District 65 inclusive of photographs, convention materials, event programs and ephemera, and documentation of Cleve Robinson and Bill Tate.
